intro: Hieracium heterochroma, commonly known as the variable hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium heterochroma is known for its variable coloration and leaf patterns, which contribute to its common name.
